intro: Impatiens ranomafanae, commonly known as the Ranomafana impatiens, is a rare flowering plant native to the rainforests of Madagascar. It belongs to the Balsaminaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red and orange. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and is adapted to the unique microclimates of its endemic habitat. Its foliage consists of heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
